Package swervelib.simulation.ironmaple.simulation.seasonspecific.reefscape2025

Class ReefscapeReefBranch

java.lang.Object
swervelib.simulation.ironmaple.simulation.Goal
swervelib.simulation.ironmaple.simulation.seasonspecific.reefscape2025.ReefscapeReefBranch
All Implemented Interfaces:
SimulatedArena.Simulatable
public class ReefscapeReefBranch extends Goal

Simulates a Reefscape branch on the field.

This class simulates a Reefscape branch where corals can be scored. This class should not be used directly and instead should be used via a ReefscapeReefSimulation which will handle an entire reef.

  • Constructor Details

    • ReefscapeReefBranch

      public ReefscapeReefBranch(Arena2025Reefscape arena, boolean isBlue, int level, int column)

      Creates a singular reef branch at the specified location

      Parameters:
      arena - The host arena of this reef.
      isBlue - Wether the position is on the blue reef or the red reef.
      level - The level of the reef (0 indexed). Range of 0-3.
      column - The pole or Colum of the reef (0 indexed). Range of 0-11.

  • Method Details

    • getPoseOfBranchAt

      public static Translation3d getPoseOfBranchAt(boolean isBlue, int level, int col)

      Returns the required pose of a reef branch at the designated position.

      Parameters:
      isBlue - Wether the position is on the blue reef or the red reef.
      level - The level of the reef (0 indexed). Range of 0-3.
      col - The pole or Colum of the reef (0 indexed). Range of 0-11.
      Returns:
      The pose of a reef branch with the specified stats.

    • getPose

    • checkRotation

      public boolean checkRotation(GamePiece gamePiece)
      Description copied from class: Goal

      Checks wether or not the submitted game piece has a rotation able to be scored in this goal

      By default the rotation needed and tolerance may be set using the Goal.setNeededAngle(Rotation3d, Angle) function. However rotation checks may be handled differently by some children making this not apply. Additionally be aware that this function only supports pitch and yaw, not role. If support for roll is needed a custom implementation will have to be created.
      Overrides:
      checkRotation in class Goal
      Parameters:
      gamePiece - The game piece to have its rotation checked.
      Returns:
      Wether or not the pieces rotation is consistent with rotation that are able to be scored in this goal.

    • addPoints

      protected void addPoints()
      Description copied from class: Goal

      Adds points when a piece has been successfully scored in this goal

      Since this function is the only trigger called when a piece is scored it may handle other small things outside of adding points.
      Specified by:
      addPoints in class Goal
